command.hint: force ordinary space
following period ends sentence
new line
thin space
thick space, math mode
medium space, math mode
negative thin space, math mode
hyphenation, see tabbing
set tab, see tabbing
tab, see tabbing
back tab, see tabbing
see tabbing
accent or tabbing
accent or tabbing
double vertical lines, math mode
define math environment
define math environment
define displaymath environment
define displaymath environment

command.name: \documentclass
command.hint: declares a document to be of the specified style

command.name: \DeclareRobustCommand
command.hint: used to define a robust command

argument.name: cmd
argument.hint: the name of the new command

argument.name: args
argument.hint: 1 to 9 denoting the number of arguments

argument.name: def
argument.hint: the text to be substituted for every occurrence of cmd

command.name: \addcontentsline
command.hint: adds an entry to the specified list or table

argument.name: file
argument.hint: extension of the file on which information is to be written

argument.name: sec_unit
argument.hint: controls the formatting of the entry

argument.name: entry
argument.hint: the text of the entry

argument.name: file
argument.hint: adds text directly to the file that generates the table of contents or list of figures

argument.name: text
argument.hint: the information to be written

command.name: \addtocounter
command.hint: increments the counter by the amount specified by the value argument

command.name: \address
command.hint: return address, as it should appear on the letter and the envelope

command.name: \addtolength
command.hint: increments a length command (len-cmd)

argument.name: len-cmd
argument.hint: length command

command.name: \addvspace
command.hint: adds a vertical space of height length

command.name: \alph
command.hint: causes the current value of counter to be printed in alphabetic characters

command.name: \appendix
command.hint: changes the way sectional units are numbered

command.name: \arabic
command.hint: causes the current value of counter to be printed in Arabic numbers

command.name: \author
command.hint: declares the author(s)

argument.name: names
argument.hint: list of authors separated by \and commands

command.name: \baselineskip
command.hint: a length command which specifies the minimum space between the botton of two successive lines in a paragraph

command.name: \baselinestretch
command.hint: scales the value of \baselineskip

command.name: \bf
command.hint: boldface typeface

command.name: \bibitem
command.hint: generates an entry labeled by label

argument.name: cite_key
argument.hint: mnemonic consisting of any sequence of letters, numbers, and punctuation symbols not containing a comma

command.name: \bibliography
command.hint: set bibliography file

argument.name: file
argument.hint: filename of the bibliography file

command.name: \bibliographystyle
command.hint: sets the bibliography style

argument.name: style
argument.hint: bibliography style

command.name: \bigskip
command.hint: equivalent to \vspace{\bigskipamount}

command.name: \boldmath
command.hint: switches to a bold math italic font

command.name: \cal
command.hint: twenty-six calligraphic letters are provided, these can only be used in math mode

command.name: \caption
command.hint: used to generate a caption for a figure or a table

argument.name: lst-entry
argument.hint: may be used to generate an entry for a list of figures or tables

command.name: \cdots
command.hint: produces a horizontal ellipsis where the dots are raised to the center of the line (math mode)

command.name: \centering
command.hint: corresponds to the center environment

command.name: \chapter
command.hint: starts a new chapter in the document structure

command.name: \circle
command.hint: produces a circle of the specified diameter

argument.hint: solid circle

command.name: \cite
command.hint: in-text citation to the references associated with the keys in key_list

argument.name: key_list
argument.hint: list of citation keys

command.name: \cleardoublepage
command.hint: ends the current page and causes all figures and tables to be printed

command.name: \clearpage
command.hint: ends the current page and causes all figures and tables to be printed

command.name: \cline
command.hint: draws horizontal lines across the columns specified

argument.name: i
argument.hint: beginning column

argument.name: j
argument.hint: ending column

command.name: \closing
command.hint: letter closes with a \closing command

argument.name: text
argument.hint: mandatory argument, text is the desired text

command.name: \dashbox
command.hint: like \framebox but has an extra argument which specifies the width of each dash

command.name: \date
command.hint: declares text to be the document's date

command.name: \ddots
command.hint: produces a diagonal ellipsis (math mode)

command.name: \dotfill
command.hint: produces a rubber length that produces dots instead of just spaces

command.name: \em
command.hint: emphasis (toggles between \it and \rm)

command.name: \emph
command.hint: emphasis the given text

command.name: \ensuremath
command.hint: the argument is always set in math mode, regardless of the current mode (LaTeX2e)

command.name: \fbox
command.hint: same as the \mbox command, except that it puts a rectangular frame around the box

command.name: \flushbottom
command.hint: makes all text pages the same height

command.name: \fnsymbol
command.hint: causes the current value of counter to be printed for numbering footnotes (math mode)

command.name: \footnote
command.hint: places a numbered footnote at the bottom of the current page

command.name: \footnotemark
command.hint: puts the footnote number in the text

command.name: \footnotesize
command.hint: third smallest of 10 typefaces available

command.name: \footnotetext
command.hint: places the text in the argument at the bottom of the page

command.name: \frac
command.hint: produces the fraction num divided by den

command.name: \frame
command.hint: puts a rectangular frame around the object specified in the argument

command.name: \framebox
command.hint: same as the \makebox command, except that it puts a frame around the box

command.name: \frenchspacing
command.hint: tells LaTeX not to insert extra space at the end of sentences

command.name: \hfill
command.hint: produces a rubber length which will be filled with spaces

command.name: \hline
command.hint: draw a horizontal line

command.name: \hrulefill
command.hint: produces a rubber length which will be filled with a horizontal rule

command.name: \hspace
command.hint: adds horizontal space

command.name: \huge
command.hint: aecond largest of 10 typefaces available

command.name: \Huge
command.hint: largest of 10 typefaces available

command.name: \hyphenation
command.hint: declares allowed hyphenation points

argument.name: words
argument.hint: list of words, separated by spaces, in which each hyphenation point is indicated by a - character

command.name: \include
command.hint: selective inclusion of files

command.name: \includeonly
command.hint: controls which files will be read in by an \include command

command.name: \includegraphics
command.hint: includes a graphic; requires package 'graphicx'

command.name: \indent
command.hint: produces a horizontal space whose width equals the width of the paragraph indentation

command.name: \input
command.hint: causes the indicated file to be read and processed

command.name: \it
command.hint: italics typeface

command.name: \item
command.hint: starts a new item in a List Environment

command.name: \kill
command.hint: set tab stops without producing text

command.name: \label
command.hint: assigns to the key the number of the current sectional unit

command.name: \large
command.hint: slightly larger than default typeface size

command.name: \LARGE
command.hint: third largest of typefaces available

command.name: \Large
command.hint: fourth largest of typefaces available

command.name: \ldots
command.hint: produces an ellipsis

command.name: \left
command.hint: '(' (math mode)

command.name: \lefteqn
command.hint: prints eqn in display math style

command.name: \linebreak
command.hint: break the current line

argument.name: number
argument.hint: 0 to 4, the higher the number, the more insistent the request is

command.name: \linewidth
command.hint: the width of lines in the current environment

command.name: \location
command.hint: modifies your organization's standard address

command.name: \makebox
command.hint: creates a box to contain the specified text

argument.name: width
argument.hint: the width of the box

argument.name: position
argument.hint: specify the position of text within the box

argumentValue.hint: interword space adjusted so text fills box exactly

command.name: \maketitle
command.hint: generates a title on a separate title page

command.name: \markboth
command.hint: conjunction with the page style myheadings

command.name: \markright
command.hint: conjunction with the page style myheadings

command.name: \mbox
command.hint: creates a box just wide enough to hold the text in its argument

argument.name: text
argument.hint: the text in the box

command.name: \medskip
command.hint: adds vertical space specified by \medskipamount

command.name: \newcommand
command.hint: used to define a command

argument.name: cmd
argument.hint: the name of the new command

argument.name: args
argument.hint: 1 to 9 denoting the number of arguments

argument.name: opt
argument.hint: if present, then the first argument is optional (LaTeX2e)

argument.name: def
argument.hint: the text to be substituted for every occurrence of cmd

command.name: \newcounter
command.hint: defines a new counter

argument.name: newname
argument.hint: the name of the new counter

argument.name: oldcounter
argument.hint: the name of an already defined counter

command.name: \newenvironment
command.hint: define an environment

argument.name: name
argument.hint: the name of the environment

argument.name: args
argument.hint: 1 to 9 denoting the number of arguments of the newly-defined environment

argument.name: opt
argument.hint: if present, then the first argument is optional (LaTeX2e)

argument.name: begdef
argument.hint: the text substituted for every occurrence of \begin{name}

argument.name: enddef
argument.hint: the text substituted for every occurrence of \end{name}

command.name: \newfont
command.hint: defines a command, which must not be currently defined, to be a declaration that selects the font named font_name to be the current font

argument.name: cmd
argument.hint: the command name

argument.name: font_name
argument.hint: the font name

command.name: \newlength
command.hint: defines the mandatory argument as a length command with a value of 0in

argument.name: gnat
argument.hint: the name of the length command

command.name: \newpage
command.hint: ends the current page

command.name: \newsavebox
command.hint: declares cmd to be a bin for saving boxes

argument.name: cmd
argument.hint: the command name

command.name: \newtheorem
command.hint: defines a theorem-like environment

argument.name: env_name
argument.hint: the name of the environment

argument.name: caption
argument.hint: the text printed at the beginning of the environment

argument.name: within
argument.hint: the name of an already defined counter, usually of a sectional unit

command.name: \nocite
command.hint: produces no text, but writes a key list on the aux file

argument.name: key_list
argument.hint: the key list

command.name: \noindent
command.hint: to suppress the paragraph indentation

command.name: \nolinebreak
command.hint: prevents LaTeX from breaking the current line at the point of the command

argument.name: number
argument.hint: 0 to 4, the higher the number, the more insistent the request is

command.name: \normalsize
command.hint: is the default type size

command.name: \nopagebreak
command.hint: prevents LaTeX form breaking the current page at the point of the command

argument.name: number
argument.hint: 0 to 4, the higher the number, the more insistent the request is

command.name: \onecolumn
command.hint: starts a new page and produces single-column output

command.name: \opening
command.hint: the letter begins with the \opening command

argument.name: text
argument.hint: what ever text you wish to start your letter

command.name: \oval
command.hint: produces a rectangle with rounded corners

argument.name: portion
argument.hint: allows you to select part of the oval

command.name: \overline
command.hint: causes the argument to be overlined

command.name: \pagebreak
command.hint: break the current page at the point of the command

argument.name: number
argument.hint: 0 to 4, the higher the number, the more insistent the request is

command.name: \pagenumbering
command.hint: specifies the style of page numbers

argument.name: num_style
argument.hint: the style of page numbers

command.name: \pageref
command.hint: produces the page number refering to the label

argument.name: key
argument.hint: the label in the text

command.name: \pagestyle
command.hint: changes the style from the current page on throughout the remainder of your document

argumentValue.hint: produces empty heads and feet - no page numbers
puts running headings on each page
you specify what is to go in the heading (\markboth or \markright)

command.name: \par
command.hint: equivalent to a blank line

command.name: \paragraph
command.hint: starts a new paragraph in the document structure

command.name: \part
command.hint: starts a new part in the document structure

command.name: \parbox
command.hint: creates a box whose contents are created in paragraph mode

argumentValue.hint: moves the item to the top of the rectangle
moves the item to the bottom

argument.name: width
argument.hint: specifies the width of the parbox

argument.name: text
argument.hint: the text that goes inside the parbox

command.name: \parindent
command.hint: normal paragraph indentation

command.name: \parskip
command.hint: is the extra vertical space inserted before a paragraph

command.name: \protect
command.hint: applies only to the immediately following command

command.name: \providecommand
command.hint: define (or redefine) a command

argument.name: cmd
argument.hint: the name of the new command

argument.name: args
argument.hint: 1 to 9 denoting the number of arguments

argument.name: opt
argument.hint: if present, then the first argument is optional (LaTeX2e)

argument.name: def
argument.hint: the text to be substituted for every occurrence of cmd

command.name: \put
command.hint: places an object at the given coordinates

argument.name: object
argument.hint: the object to place

command.name: \raggedbottom
command.hint: makes all pages the height of the text on that page

command.name: \raggedright
command.hint: corresponds to the flushleft environment

command.name: \raisebox
command.hint: creates a LR box containing text; it is used to raise or lower text

argument.name: distance
argument.hint: specifies how high the text is to be raised

argument.name: extend-above
argument.hint: makes LaTeX think that the text extends above the current line

argument.name: extend-below
argument.hint: makes LaTeX think that the text extends below the current line

command.name: \ref
command.hint: produces the number of the sectional unit, equation number, ... of the corresponding \label command

argument.name: key
argument.hint: corresponding label

command.name: \eqref
command.hint: produces the number of the sectional unit, equation number, ... of the corresponding \label command

argument.name: key
argument.hint: corresponding label

command.name: \right
command.hint: ')' (math mode)

command.name: \rm
command.hint: Roman typeface (default)

command.name: \roman
command.hint: causes the current value of counter to be printed in roman numerals

command.name: \rule
command.hint: generates a rectangular 'blob of ink.', it can be used to produce horizontal or vertical lines

argument.name: raise-height
argument.hint: specifies how high to raise the rule

argument.name: width
argument.hint: specifies the length of the rule

argument.name: height
argument.hint: specifies the height of the rule

command.name: \savebox
command.hint: typeset text in a box

command.name: \sbox
command.hint: typeset text in a box

command.name: \sc
command.hint: small caps typeface

command.name: \scriptsize
command.hint: second smallest of 10 typefaces available

command.name: \section
command.hint: starts a new section in the document structure

command.name: \setcounter
command.hint: sets the value of the specified counter

command.name: \setlength
command.hint: used to set the value of a length command

command.name: \sf
command.hint: sans serif typeface

command.name: \shortstack
command.hint: produces a stack of objects

argumentValue.hint: moves the objects to the right of the stack
moves the objects to the left of the stack
moves the objects to the center of the stack (default)

argument.hint: stack of objects

command.name: \signature
command.hint: your name, as it should appear at the end of the letter underneath the space for your signature

command.name: \sl
command.hint: slanted typeface

command.name: \small
command.hint: slightly smaller than default typeface size

command.name: \smallskip
command.hint: equivalent to \vspace{\smallskipamount}

command.name: \renewcommand
command.hint: used to define a command

argument.name: cmd
argument.hint: the name of the new command

argument.name: args
argument.hint: 1 to 9 denoting the number of arguments

argument.name: opt
argument.hint: if present, then the first argument is optional (LaTeX2e)

argument.name: def
argument.hint: the text to be substituted for every occurrence of cmd

command.name: \sqrt
command.hint: produces the square root (radical) symbol with the argument as radicand

command.name: \stackrel
command.hint: can be used to stack something above something else; used in math mode

command.name: \subparagraph
command.hint: starts a new subparagraph in the document structure

command.name: \subsection
command.hint: starts a new subsection in the document structure

command.name: \subsubsection
command.hint: starts a new subsubsection in the document structure

command.name: \tableofcontents
command.hint: produces a table of contents

command.name: \telephone
command.hint: this is your telephone number

command.name: \text
command.hint: include normal text in math environments

command.name: \textit
command.hint: italic text

command.name: \textbf
command.hint: bold text

command.name: \textwidth
command.hint: is the normal width of the text on a page

command.name: \textheight
command.hint: the height of text on the page

command.name: \thanks
command.hint: produces a footnote to the title

command.name: \thispagestyle
command.hint: changes the style for the current page

command.name: \tiny
command.hint: smallest of 10 typefaces available

command.name: \title
command.hint: declares text to be the title

command.name: \today
command.hint: generates the current date in the format Month dd, year

command.name: \tt
command.hint: Typewriter typeface

command.name: \twocolumn
command.hint: declaration starts a new page and produces two-column output

command.name: \typeout
command.hint: prints msg on the terminal and in the log file

command.name: \typein
command.hint: prints msg on the terminal and causes LaTeX to stop and wait for you to type a line of input, ending with return

argument.name: cmd
argument.hint: command name

command.name: \underbrace
command.hint: generates a brace underneath the formula (math mode)

command.name: \underline
command.hint: causes the argument text to be underlined

command.name: \unitlength
command.hint: defines the units used in the Picture Environment

command.name: \usebox
command.hint: prints the box most recently saved in cmd by a \savebox or \sbox command

command.name: \usecounter
command.hint: used in the second argument of the list environment to allow the counter specified to be used to number the list items

command.name: \usepackage
command.hint: loads the given LaTeX packages

command.name: \value
command.hint: produces the value of the counter named in the mandatory argument

command.name: \vdots
command.hint: command produces a vertical ellipsis

command.name: \vector
command.hint: draws an arrow of the specified length and slope (picture environment)

command.name: \verb
command.hint: verbatim text

command.name: \vfill
command.hint: produces a rubber length which can stretch or shrink vertically

command.name: \vline
command.hint: will draw a vertical line extending the full height and depth of its row

command.name: \vphantom
command.hint: creates a zero-width object with the height of construct

command.name: \vspace
command.hint: adds vertical space

command.name: \begin
command.hint: paragraph-making environments

command.name: \end
command.hint: closing environment

command.name: \line
command.hint: draws a line of the specified length and slope

argument.name: x-slope
argument.hint: the x-coordinate of the slope

argument.name: y-slope
argument.hint: the y-coordinate of the slope

command.name: \linethickness
command.hint: declares the thickness of horizontal and vertical lines in a picture environment

argument.name: dimension
argument.hint: must be a positive length

command.name: \makebox
command.hint: creates a box with a specified with and height

argument.name: width
argument.hint: the width of the box

argument.name: height
argument.hint: the height of the box

argument.name: position
argument.hint: specifies the quadrant that your text appears in

argumentValue.hint: moves the item to the top of the rectangle
moves the item to the bottom
moves the item to the left
moves the item to the right

command.name: \multiput
command.usage: \multiput(@x coord@,@y coord@)(@delta x@,@delta y@){@number of copies@}{@object@}
command.hint: used to put the same object in a regular pattern across a picture

command.name: \mathcal
command.hint: calligraphic letter (LaTeX2e)

argument.name: cal
argument.hint: the letter

command.name: \mathop
command.hint: argument is considered to be a single variable sized math symbol

command.name: \not
command.hint: a slash is placed through the next symbol (or letter)

command.name: \overbrace
command.hint: generates a brace over equation

command.name: \multicolumn
command.hint: used to make an entry that spans several columns

argument.name: cols
argument.hint: the number of columns to span

argument.name: pos
argument.hint: the formatting of the entry

argument.name: text
argument.hint: the text

command.name: \newline
command.hint: breaks the line right where it is
